snippet: Two bombs exploded seconds apart near the finish line at the Boston Marathon on Monday, creating a bloody, chaotic scene more than four hours into the race.
abstract: Two powerful bombs explode near finish line of Boston Marathon, killing three people, including 8-year-old child, and injuring more than 100; one of Boston’s most cherished rites of spring is transformed from scene of cheers and sweaty triumph to one of screams and carnage.

byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and MICHAEL COOPER
byline.contributor: John Eligon reported from Boston, and Michael Cooper from New York. Reporting was contributed by Steve Eder, Ashley Parker, William K. Rashbaum, Katharine Q. Seelye and Mary Pilon from New York, Mark Landler, Michael S. Schmidt, Eric Schmitt and Abby Goodnough from Washington, and Joel Elliott, Dina Kraft, Tim Rohan and Brent McDonald from Boston.

lead_paragraph: Two bombs exploded seconds apart near the finish line at the Boston Marathon on Monday, creating a bloody, chaotic scene more than four hours into the race.

headline.seo: 2 Blasts at Boston Marathon Kill at Least 3 and Injure More Than 100
headline.main: Blasts at Boston Marathon Kill 3 and Injure 100
headline.print_headline: Blasts at Boston Marathon Kill 3 and Injure 100
